title: How do you know what's real when misinformation is everywhere?
teaser: AI deepfakes. Conspiracy theories. Your feed is a weapon. Where's the solid ground?

panels.heading: THE FLOOD OF LIES
panels.content:
AI deepfakes are everywhere. You can't tell what's real anymore.

Misinformation and disinformation ranked #2 on the World Economic Forum's global risk list. Ahead of climate change. Ahead of economic collapse.

Your uncle believes QAnon. Your coworker shares conspiracy theories. Your feed is engineered for virality, not truth.

Political polarization creates competing realities—Red truth, Blue truth, no shared truth.

You're exhausted from fact-checking everything. From second-guessing every headline. From wondering if the video you just watched was even real.

How do you know what's true anymore?

panels.heading: THE MYTH OF "DOING YOUR OWN RESEARCH"
panels.content:
You thought if you just read enough articles, watched enough videos, followed enough experts—you'd find truth.

So you scroll. You research. You compare sources. You join forums, read Substacks, listen to podcasts.

But the more you search, the more confused you become.

Because **the algorithm doesn't care about truth. It cares about engagement.**

And "doing your own research" in a misinformation flood isn't discernment. It's drowning.

You can't think your way to solid ground when the very information you're standing on is quicksand.

panels.heading: THE COST OF LIQUID REALITY
panels.content:
The cost of living in liquid reality is this: **you stop trusting anything.**

You don't trust the news. You don't trust scientists. You don't trust institutions, experts, or even your own perceptions.

Reality becomes whatever your tribe says it is. Truth becomes tribal.

You're so busy defending your version of reality that you've forgotten what it feels like to stand on something unshakeable.

And the exhaustion is crushing.

Because **when everything is contested, nothing is certain.**

When truth is just another opinion, how do you live?

illustration.description: Dithered ink drawing of person standing in water/flood with fragmented reflections OR multiple mirrors showing different versions of same person

panels.heading: "WHAT IS TRUTH?"
panels.content:
2,000 years ago, a man stood trial.

The Roman governor, Pilate, asked him:

**"What is truth?"**

It's the most modern question in the ancient world.

Pilate was cynical. Exhausted by competing claims. Drowning in political narratives.

And the man on trial—Jesus of Nazareth—had already answered:

**"I am the way, the truth, and the life."**

Not *a* truth among many. Not truth as information.

Truth as a **person**. Truth you can know. Truth that stands when everything else shifts.

panels.heading: GROUNDED IN THE ONE WHO DOESN'T LIE
panels.content:
Jesus said:

**"You will know the truth, and the truth will set you free."**

Not "you'll find truth by scrolling." Not "truth is whatever you believe."

**You will KNOW the truth.**

Know. Personally. Relationally.

In a world where AI generates lies and algorithms weaponize information, truth isn't something you research.

It's Someone you encounter.

And when you're rooted in the One who said **"I am the truth"**—not in news cycles, not in tribal narratives—you have solid ground.

Because God doesn't lie. God doesn't shift. God doesn't generate deepfakes.

panels.heading: THE INVITATION
panels.content:
God,

I'm drowning in lies.

I don't know what's real anymore. I don't know who to trust. I'm exhausted from fact-checking everything and still feeling lost.

I need solid ground.

You said You are the truth. Not information—a person.

Teach me what it means to know You. Not just know about You.

Root me in what doesn't shift.

Amen.
